How to Use Our Time Calculator

  1. Enter Start Time: Input your starting time (hour, minute, AM/PM)
  2. Set End Time: Enter your ending time or duration
  3. Choose Format: Select 12-hour or 24-hour time format
  4. View Results: See time difference, duration, and breakdown
  5. Convert Units: Switch between hours, minutes, and seconds

Time Calculation Formula

Time difference is calculated using:

Duration = End Time - Start Time

Our calculator handles:

Hours = Total Minutes รท 60

Minutes = Total Seconds รท 60

Time calculations account for different time zones and daylight saving time when applicable.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I calculate time differences?

Subtract the start time from the end time. If the end time is earlier in the day than the start time, add 24 hours to the end time. Our calculator handles this automatically.

What's the difference between 12-hour and 24-hour time?

12-hour time uses AM/PM (1:00 PM), while 24-hour time uses 0-23 hours (13:00). 24-hour time is more precise and commonly used in professional settings and international contexts.

How do I calculate work hours and overtime?

Calculate total hours worked, then subtract regular hours (typically 8) to find overtime. Overtime is usually paid at 1.5x the regular rate for hours over 40 per week.

Can I calculate time across different time zones?

Yes, our calculator can handle time zone conversions. Enter times in different zones and see the equivalent times, accounting for time zone differences and daylight saving time.

How do I convert between different time units?

Use our calculator to convert between hours, minutes, and seconds: 1 hour = 60 minutes = 3,600 seconds. This is useful for payroll, project tracking, and time management.
